column4: i've just installed sun virtualbox but could not find that applicatin in the applications list
from command line its 'virtualbox' or 'Virtualbox' i belive.
it proberly is in the menus.. you just aint seeing it..  perhaps log out/back in..
reading of the virtualbox manual/guide at its homepage  #1 tip
best advice for mint... dont bother.. stick with and learn ubuntu.
well if yusing linux.. it has a 'linux' item...
i doubt if it really matters much.
go for it then.
did i mention a tip about reading the virtualbox manual?       it proberly dosent matter really..
pick ubuntu then?
if its source - you compile it..
theres various tools like 'gnome-art' that let you easially install most theme parts from the gnome art web site.
find it at the various gnome art web sites and download it..
not all 'themes' are actually themes.. many are  theme 'parts'
it seems that an Aurora theme engine is in the repos.
bit that seems to be in Lucid only
it will still work.. just not look 100% like intended.  Not really a big deal. I mix and match the theme parts how i like anyway
or use the PPA repos for the different theme parts --> https://launchpad.net/~merlwiz79/+archive/aurora
so use that ppa repo
i dont bend over to far backwards for themes any more.. most look almost identical. and theres very good ones allready in the repos ready to be installed. or in alternative PPA repos.
that url i gave. has the theme engine - allready done. so you can instgll it with a few commands.
